items.text:
Used to evaluate risks to critical equipment, telephone room, data center, etc.

Instructions:

1. Complete this form for each area where critical equipment is installed.

2. Mitigate risks by reviewing this list while planning new construction, renovations, and relocation.
Building name and address:
Floor Number:
Area evaluated (department, room number, or equipment name):
Are there water lines, drains, or other pipes carrying liquid in the ceiling above the equipment?
Do these lines, if any, feature fittings, valves or other connections above the equipment?
If pipes and fittings can not be relocated, what can be done to determine their integrity?
Describe any evidence of leakage.
Note any repairs scheduled to water systems located above the equipment.
On the floor directly above the equipment, are there any restrooms, sinks, fountains, or other fixtures containing water, steam or liquid?
Are locations of shutoff valves shown on accessible floor diagrams of the floor where the equipment is located, and the floor directly above?
Are shutoff valves marked and easily accessible?
Does the floor directly above the equipment contain any penetrations for conduit, cable, pipe, etc?
If yes, are open spaces sealed to prevent water penetration?
Is a spill response kit including plastic sheeting to protect equipment readily available?
Have all staff including operators, maintenance and cleaning staff been trained to report any type of liquid leak to the maintenance department for immediate attention?
If leakage occurs or is likely to occur, are attendees instructed to shut off power when safe to do so, and protect equipment with plastic sheets?
For equipment areas in the basement, are there any water mains, sprinkler mains or liquid utility pipes entering through the walls or floor?
Is an underground plan of utility mains immediately available showing the location of shutoff valves in the event an underground leak causes water to flow through the wall or floor opening?
For areas that are periodically unoccupied, are water sensors installed on the floor, or are humidity sensors available to provide an alarm to a constantly attended position?
